frameDefinitions: This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
A Visitor arrives at the Host_location as a guest of the Host, for the purpose of achieving a Purpose.
The words in this frame describe an Experiencer's emotions with respect to some Content.
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
The lexical units in this frame are descriptions of a Cognizer's Attitude about or outlook on a State_of_affairs.     ''
This frame characterizes the likelihood that a Hypothetical_event will happen as a position on a scale of impossible to inevitable.
frameExamples: It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
I'm gonna <t>drop</t> <t>in</t> on Kieth for a while.
My <t>enjoyment</t> of the movie was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me.
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
Carl is becoming more <t>pessimistic</t> about the negotiations every day.
listRoleDefinitions: The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at the Host_location to visit the <fen>Host</fen> for a <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The <fen>Host</fen> is the person highly associated with the goal location of the <fen>Visitor</fen>, and who allows the <fen>Visitor</fen> onto his/her territory, and possibly to make use of available resources. The <fen>Host</fen> and <fen>Visitor</fen> and in a host-guest relationship.
The <fen>Host_location</fen> is a place primarily associated with the <fen>Host</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.
The larger area within which the visiting takes place.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion or other internal state.

<fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings or experiences are directed towards or based upon.  The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflect his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the particular experience.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the specified emotional state.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The person whose <fen>Attitude</fen> about a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is being expressed.
The outlook or viewpoint expressed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
An event, topic, or situation about which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has an <fen>Attitude</fen>.
The Time interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the <fen>Attitude</fen> about the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
A numerical representation of the probability that a Hypothetical_event will occur.
A metaphorical representation of the position on the scale of likelihood that the Hypothetical_event will occur.
The event that is expected to happen with a certain likelihood.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.
The delight <fex>on her face</fex> was mixed with asonishment.
Mr. Whiskers was upset <fex>about his cat treats</fex>.
It felt pretty awkward to partake in such a nervous <fex>ceremony</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex>, Bob was still interested in the young Republicans.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
<fex>Americans</fex> are optimistic despite the climbing unemployment rate.
Michelle had a somewhat negative <fex>outlook</fex> on the direction her life was heading.
<fex>The economy</fex> looks quite grim at this moment.
There's a <fex>95 %</fex> chance of rain today.
Chances are <fex>slim</fex> that he'll pull through.
He's got a small chance <fex>of making it out alive</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Crossroads, Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation
A View From the American States
Annual Survey of State Government Finances
the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act
The Value of Medicare Advantage Employer Group Waiver Plans
Medicare Advantage or Employer Group Waiver Plans
